pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing suspension

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:0.4.eng: 9. The second training rule on anger

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:1.1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā rājagahe viharati veḷuvane kalandakanivāpe.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:1.1.1.eng: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Rājagaha in the Bamboo Grove,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:1.1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena mettiyabhūmajakā bhikkhū gijjhakūṭā pabbatā orohantā addasaṃsu chagalakaṃ ajikāya vippaṭipajjantaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:1.1.2.eng: the monks Mettiya and Bhūmajaka were descending from the Vulture Peak when they saw two goats copulating.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:1.1.4.pli: “handa mayaṃ, āvuso, imaṃ chagalakaṃ dabbaṃ mallaputtaṃ nāma karoma.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:1.1.4.eng: “Let’s give the he-goat the name Dabba the Mallian

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:1.1.5.pli: Imaṃ ajikaṃ mettiyaṃ nāma bhikkhuniṃ karoma.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:1.1.5.eng: and the she-goat the name Mettiyā the nun.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:1.1.7.pli: Pubbe mayaṃ, āvuso, dabbaṃ mallaputtaṃ sutena avocumhā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:1.1.7.eng: ‘Previously we spoke of what we had heard,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:1.1.8.pli: Idāni pana amhehi sāmaṃ diṭṭho mettiyāya bhikkhuniyā vippaṭipajjanto”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:1.1.8.eng: but now we’ve seen Dabba copulating with the nun Mettiyā.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:1.1.9.pli: Te taṃ chagalakaṃ dabbaṃ mallaputtaṃ nāma akaṃsu.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:1.1.9.eng: They then gave them those names

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:1.1.10.pli: Taṃ ajikaṃ mettiyaṃ nāma bhikkhuniṃ akaṃsu.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:1.1.12.pli: “pubbe mayaṃ, āvuso, dabbaṃ mallaputtaṃ sutena avocumhā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:1.1.12.eng: “Previously we spoke of what we had heard,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:1.1.13.pli: Idāni pana amhehi sāmaṃ diṭṭho mettiyāya bhikkhuniyā vippaṭipajjanto”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:1.1.13.eng: but now we’ve seen Dabba copulating with the nun Mettiyā.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:1.1.17.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:1.1.18.pli: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṃ nidāne etasmiṃ pakaraṇe bhikkhusaṅghaṃ sannipātāpetvā āyasmantaṃ dabbaṃ mallaputtaṃ paṭipucchi—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:1.1.18.eng: Soon afterwards the Buddha had the Sangha gathered and questioned Dabba:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:1.1.19.pli: “sarasi tvaṃ, dabba, evarūpaṃ kattā yathayime bhikkhū āhaṃsū”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:1.1.19.eng: “Dabba, do you remember doing as these monks say?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:1.1.22.pli: tatiyampi kho bhagavā āyasmantaṃ dabbaṃ mallaputtaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:1.1.22.eng: and a third time the Buddha asked

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:1.1.23.pli: “sarasi tvaṃ, dabba, evarūpaṃ kattā yathayime bhikkhū āhaṃsū”ti?

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:1.1.25.eng: He then said, “Dabba, the Dabbas don’t give such evasive answers.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:1.1.26.eng: If it was done by you, say so;

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:1.1.27.eng: if it wasn’t done by you, then say that.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:1.1.28.pli: “Yato ahaṃ, bhante, jāto nābhijānāmi supinantenapi methunadhammaṃ paṭisevitā, pageva jāgaro”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:1.1.28.eng: “Since I was born, sir, I don’t recall having sexual intercourse even in a dream, let alone when awake.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:1.1.29.pli: Atha kho bhagavā bhikkhū āmantesi—“tena hi, bhikkhave, ime bhikkhū anuyuñjathā”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:1.1.29.eng: “Well then, monks, call those monks to account.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:1.1.30.pli: Idaṃ vatvā bhagavā uṭṭhāyāsanā vihāraṃ pāvisi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:1.1.30.eng: And the Buddha got up from his seat and entered his dwelling.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:1.2.1.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū mettiyabhūmajake bhikkhū anuyuñjiṃsu.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:1.2.1.eng: The monks then questioned Mettiya and Bhūmajaka, who told them what had happened.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:1.2.2.pli: Te bhikkhūhi anuyuñjīyamānā bhikkhūnaṃ etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ—

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:1.2.3.pli: “kiṃ pana tumhe, āvuso, āyasmantaṃ dabbaṃ mallaputtaṃ aññabhāgiyassa adhikaraṇassa kiñci desaṃ lesamattaṃ upādāya pārājikena dhammena anuddhaṃsethā”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:1.2.3.eng: “So did you charge Venerable Dabba with an offense entailing expulsion, using an unrelated legal issue as a pretext?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:1.2.5.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:1.2.5.eng: The monks of few desires complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:1.2.6.pli: “kathañhi nāma mettiyabhūmajakā bhikkhū āyasmantaṃ dabbaṃ mallaputtaṃ aññabhāgiyassa adhikaraṇassa kiñci desaṃ lesamattaṃ upādāya pārājikena dhammena anuddhaṃsessantī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:1.2.6.eng: “How could Mettiya and Bhūmajaka charge Venerable Dabba with an offense entailing expulsion, using an unrelated legal issue as a pretext?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:1.2.7.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū mettiyabhūmajake bhikkhū anekapariyāyena vigarahitvā bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:1.2.7.eng: They rebuked those monks in many ways and then told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned those monks:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:1.2.8.pli: “saccaṃ kira tumhe, bhikkhave, dabbaṃ mallaputtaṃ aññabhāgiyassa adhikaraṇassa kiñci desaṃ lesamattaṃ upādāya pārājikena dhammena anuddhaṃsethā”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:1.2.8.eng: “Is it true, monks, that you did this?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:1.2.11.pli: “kathañhi nāma tumhe, moghapurisā, dabbaṃ mallaputtaṃ aññabhāgiyassa adhikaraṇassa kiñci desaṃ lesamattaṃ upādāya pārājikena dhammena anuddhaṃsessatha.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:1.2.11.eng: “Foolish men, how could you do this?

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:1.2.13.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:1.2.13.eng: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:1.2.14.1.pli: “Yo pana bhikkhu bhikkhuṃ duṭṭho doso appatīto aññabhāgiyassa adhikaraṇassa kiñci desaṃ lesamattaṃ upādāya pārājikena dhammena anuddhaṃseyya— ‘appeva nāma naṃ imamhā brahmacariyā cāveyyan’ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:1.2.14.1.eng: ‘If a monk who is angry and displeased, uses an unrelated legal issue as a pretext to charge a monk with an offense entailing expulsion, aiming to make him leave the monastic life,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:1.2.15.pli: Tato aparena samayena samanuggāhīyamāno vā asamanuggāhīyamāno vā aññabhāgiyañceva taṃ adhikaraṇaṃ hoti koci deso lesamatto upādinno, bhikkhu ca dosaṃ patiṭṭhāti, saṅghādiseso”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:1.2.15.eng: and then after some time, whether he is questioned or not, it is clear that the legal issue is unrelated and was used as a pretext, and he admits to his ill will, he commits an offense entailing suspension.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:2.1.4.eng: … The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:2.1.8.eng: upset, dissatisfied, discontent, having hatred, hostile.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:2.1.10.pli: tena ca kopena, tena ca dosena, tāya ca anattamanatāya, tāya ca anabhiraddhiyā appatīto hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:2.1.10.eng: because of that upset, that ill will, that dissatisfaction, and that discontent, he is displeased.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:2.2.2.eng: it is either unrelated in regard to offenses or unrelated in regard to legal issues.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:2.2.3.eng: How is a legal issue unrelated to a legal issue?

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:2.2.4.eng: A legal issue arising from a dispute is unrelated to a legal issue arising from an accusation, a legal issue arising from an offense, and a legal issue arising from business.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:2.2.5.eng: A legal issue arising from an accusation is unrelated to a legal issue arising from an offense, a legal issue arising from business, and a legal issue arising from a dispute.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:2.2.6.eng: A legal issue arising from an offense is unrelated to a legal issue arising from business, a legal issue arising from a dispute, and a legal issue arising from an accusation.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:2.2.7.eng: A legal issue arising from business is unrelated to a legal issue arising from a dispute, a legal issue arising from an accusation, and a legal issue arising from an offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:2.2.8.eng: It is in this way that a legal issue is unrelated to a legal issue.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:2.2.9.eng: How is a legal issue related to a legal issue?

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:2.2.10.eng: A legal issue arising from a dispute is related to a legal issue arising from a dispute.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:2.2.11.eng: A legal issue arising from an accusation is related to a legal issue arising from an accusation.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:2.2.12.pli: Āpattādhikaraṇaṃ āpattādhikaraṇassa siyā tabbhāgiyaṃ siyā aññabhāgiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:2.2.12.eng: A legal issue arising from an offense may be either related or unrelated to a legal issue arising from an offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:2.2.13.eng: How is a legal issue arising from an offense unrelated to a legal issue arising from an offense?

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:2.2.14.eng: An offense entailing expulsion in regard to sexual intercourse is unrelated to an offense entailing expulsion in regard to stealing, an offense entailing expulsion in regard to a human being, and an offense entailing expulsion in regard to a superhuman quality.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:2.2.15.eng: An offense entailing expulsion in regard to stealing is unrelated to an offense entailing expulsion in regard to a human being, an offense entailing expulsion in regard to a superhuman quality, and an offense entailing expulsion in regard to sexual intercourse.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:2.2.16.eng: An offense entailing expulsion in regard to a human being is unrelated to an offense entailing expulsion in regard to a superhuman quality, an offense entailing expulsion in regard to sexual intercourse, and an offense entailing expulsion in regard to stealing.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:2.2.17.eng: An offense entailing expulsion in regard to a superhuman quality is unrelated to an offense entailing expulsion in regard to sexual intercourse, an offense entailing expulsion in regard to stealing, and an offense entailing expulsion in regard to a human being.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:2.2.18.eng: It is in this way that a legal issue arising from an offense is unrelated to a legal issue arising from an offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:2.2.19.eng: How is a legal issue arising from an offense related to a legal issue arising from an offense?

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:2.2.20.eng: An offense entailing expulsion in regard to sexual intercourse is related to an offense entailing expulsion in regard to sexual intercourse.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:2.2.21.eng: An offense entailing expulsion in regard to stealing is related to an offense entailing expulsion in regard to stealing.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:2.2.22.eng: An offense entailing expulsion in regard to a human being is related to an offense entailing expulsion in regard to a human being.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:2.2.23.eng: An offense entailing expulsion in regard to a superhuman quality is related to an offense entailing expulsion in regard to a superhuman quality.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:2.2.24.eng: It is in this way that a legal issue arising from an offense is related to a legal issue arising from an offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:2.2.25.eng: A legal issue arising from business is related to a legal issue arising from business.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:2.2.26.eng: It is in this way that a legal issue is related to a legal issue.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:2.3.2.pli: leso nāma dasa lesā— jātileso, nāmaleso, gottaleso, liṅgaleso, āpattileso, pattaleso, cīvaraleso, upajjhāyaleso, ācariyaleso, senāsanaleso.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:2.3.2.eng: A pretext: there are ten kinds of pretext—the pretext of caste, the pretext of name, the pretext of family, the pretext of characteristic, the pretext of offense, the pretext of almsbowl, the pretext of robe, the pretext of preceptor, the pretext of teacher, the pretext of dwelling.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:2.3.4.pli: khattiyo diṭṭho hoti pārājikaṃ dhammaṃ ajjhāpajjanto.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:2.3.4.eng: a monk sees an aristocrat committing an offense entailing expulsion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:2.3.5.eng: If he then accuses another aristocrat, saying,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:2.3.7.eng: You’ve committed an offense entailing expulsion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:2.3.8.eng: You’re not an ascetic, not a Sakyan monastic.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:2.3.9.pli: natthi tayā saddhiṃ uposatho vā pavāraṇā vā saṅghakammaṃ vā”ti,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:2.3.9.eng: You’re excluded from the observance-day ceremony, from the invitation ceremony, and from the legal procedures of the Sangha,”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:2.3.10.eng: he commits an offense entailing suspension for each statement.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:2.3.15.eng: If he then accuses another worker, saying,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:2.3.17.eng: You’ve committed an offense entailing expulsion. You’re not an ascetic, not a Sakyan monastic. …”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:2.3.18.eng: he commits an offense entailing suspension for each statement.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:2.3.20.eng: a monk sees someone whose name is Buddharakkhita …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:2.3.22.pli: saṅgharakkhito diṭṭho hoti pārājikaṃ dhammaṃ ajjhāpajjanto.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:2.3.22.eng: Saṅgharakkhita committing an offense entailing expulsion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:2.3.23.eng: If he then accuses another person called Saṅgharakkhita, saying,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:2.3.25.eng: You’ve committed an offense entailing expulsion. You’re not an ascetic, not a Sakyan monastic. …”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:2.3.26.eng: he commits an offense entailing suspension for each statement.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:2.3.28.eng: a monk sees someone whose family name is Gotama …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:2.3.31.pli: vāsiṭṭho diṭṭho hoti pārājikaṃ dhammaṃ ajjhāpajjanto.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:2.3.31.eng: Vāsiṭṭha committing an offense entailing expulsion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:2.3.32.eng: If he then accuses another person called Vāsiṭṭha, saying,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:2.3.34.eng: You’ve committed an offense entailing expulsion. You’re not an ascetic, not a Sakyan monastic. …”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:2.3.35.eng: he commits an offense entailing suspension for each statement.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:2.3.40.pli: odāto diṭṭho hoti pārājikaṃ dhammaṃ ajjhāpajjanto.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:2.3.40.eng: light-skinned committing an offense entailing expulsion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:2.3.41.eng: If he then accuses another light-skinned person, saying,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:2.3.43.eng: You’ve committed an offense entailing expulsion. You’re not an ascetic, not a Sakyan monastic. …”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:2.3.44.eng: he commits an offense entailing suspension for each statement.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:2.3.46.eng: a monk sees someone committing a light offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:2.3.47.eng: If he then accuses him of an offense entailing expulsion, saying,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:2.3.48.eng: “You’re not an ascetic, not a Sakyan monastic. …”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:2.3.49.eng: he commits an offense entailing suspension for each statement.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:2.3.51.eng: a monk sees someone carrying an iron bowl …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:2.3.52.comm: Sp 1.400: Sāṭakapattoti lohapattasadiso susaṇṭhāno succhavi siniddho bhamaravaṇṇo mattikāpatto vuccati, “Sāṭakapatta: what is meant is a ceramic bowl like an iron bowl, which is well-formed, has a nice and glossy surface, and has the color of a bee.” Thig 13.1:1.1: Kāḷakā bhamaravaṇṇasādisā, “Black like the color of a bee.” It seems plausible that this kind of bowl was made of the ceramic that is now known among archeologists as “Northern Black Polished Ware”.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:2.3.53.pli: sumbhakapattadharo diṭṭho hoti pārājikaṃ dhammaṃ ajjhāpajjanto.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:2.3.53.eng: an ordinary clay bowl committing an offense entailing expulsion.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:2.3.53.comm: Sp 1.400: Sumbhakapattoti pakatimattikāpatto, “Sumbhakapatta: an ordinary ceramic bowl.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:2.3.54.eng: If he then accuses another person carrying an ordinary clay bowl, saying,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:2.3.55.eng: “I’ve seen someone carrying an ordinary clay bowl.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:2.3.56.eng: You’ve committed an offense entailing expulsion. You’re not an ascetic, not a Sakyan monastic. …”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:2.3.57.eng: he commits an offense entailing suspension for each statement.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:2.3.59.eng: a monk sees a rag-robe wearer …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:2.3.60.pli: gahapaticīvaradharo diṭṭho hoti pārājikaṃ dhammaṃ ajjhāpajjanto.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:2.3.60.eng: wearing robes given by householders committing an offense entailing expulsion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:2.3.61.eng: If he then accuses another person wearing robes given by householders, saying,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:2.3.62.eng: “I’ve seen someone wearing robes given by householders.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:2.3.63.eng: You’ve committed an offense entailing expulsion. You’re not an ascetic, not a Sakyan monastic. …”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:2.3.64.eng: he commits an offense entailing suspension for each statement.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:2.3.66.pli: itthannāmassa saddhivihāriko diṭṭho hoti pārājikaṃ dhammaṃ ajjhāpajjanto.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:2.3.66.eng: a monk sees a student of so-and-so committing an offense entailing expulsion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:2.3.67.eng: If he then accuses another student of that person, saying,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:2.3.69.eng: You’ve committed an offense entailing expulsion. You’re not an ascetic, not a Sakyan monastic. …”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:2.3.70.eng: he commits an offense entailing suspension for each statement.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:2.3.72.pli: itthannāmassa antevāsiko diṭṭho hoti pārājikaṃ dhammaṃ ajjhāpajjanto.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:2.3.72.eng: a monk sees a pupil of so-and-so committing an offense entailing expulsion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:2.3.73.eng: If he then accuses another pupil of that person, saying,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:2.3.75.eng: You’ve committed an offense entailing expulsion. You’re not an ascetic, not a Sakyan monastic. …”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:2.3.76.eng: he commits an offense entailing suspension for each statement.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:2.3.78.pli: itthannāmasenāsanavāsiko diṭṭho hoti pārājikaṃ dhammaṃ ajjhāpajjanto.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:2.3.78.eng: a monk sees one who dwells in such-and-such a dwelling committing an offense entailing expulsion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:2.3.79.eng: If he then accuses someone else who dwells in that dwelling, saying,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:2.3.80.eng: “I’ve seen one who dwells in such-and-such a dwelling.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:2.3.81.eng: You’ve committed an offense entailing expulsion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:2.3.82.eng: You’re not an ascetic, not a Sakyan monastic.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:2.3.83.pli: natthi tayā saddhiṃ uposatho vā pavāraṇā vā saṅghakammaṃ vā”ti,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:2.3.83.eng: You’re excluded from the observance-day ceremony, from the invitation ceremony, and from the legal procedures of the Sangha,”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:2.3.84.eng: he commits an offense entailing suspension for each statement.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:2.4.4.eng: accuses him or has him accused.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:2.4.5.pli: Appeva nāma naṃ imamhā brahmacariyā cāveyyanti
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:2.4.5.eng: To make him leave the monastic life:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:2.4.6.pli: bhikkhubhāvā cāveyyaṃ, samaṇadhammā cāveyyaṃ, sīlakkhandhā cāveyyaṃ, tapoguṇā cāveyyaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:2.4.6.eng: to make him leave the monkhood, leave the state of a monastic, leave his morality, leave the virtue of monasticism.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:2.4.8.pli: yasmiṃ khaṇe anuddhaṃsito hoti, taṃ khaṇaṃ taṃ layaṃ taṃ muhuttaṃ vītivatte.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:2.4.8.eng: the moment, the instant, the second after he has laid the charge.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:2.4.10.pli: yena vatthunā anuddhaṃsito hoti tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ samanuggāhīyamāno.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:2.4.10.eng: he is questioned about the grounds of his charge.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:2.4.12.eng: he is not spoken to by anyone.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:2.4.14.pli: cattāri adhikaraṇāni— vivādādhikaraṇaṃ, anuvādādhikaraṇaṃ, āpattādhikaraṇaṃ, kiccādhikaraṇaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:2.4.14.eng: there are four kinds of legal issues: legal issues arising from disputes, legal issues arising from accusations, legal issues arising from offenses, legal issues arising from business.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:2.4.16.pli: tesaṃ lesānaṃ aññataro leso upādinno hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:2.4.16.eng: he has used a certain pretext among those listed above.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:2.4.17.eng: And he admits to his ill will:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:2.4.18.pli: tucchakaṃ mayā bhaṇitaṃ, musā mayā bhaṇitaṃ, abhūtaṃ mayā bhaṇitaṃ, ajānantena mayā bhaṇitaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:2.4.18.eng: “What I said was empty,” “What I said was false,” “What I said was unreal,” “I said it without knowing.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:2.4.19.eng: He commits an offense entailing suspension:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:2.4.20.eng: … Therefore, too, it is called “an offense entailing suspension”.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:3.1.1.pli: Bhikkhu saṅghādisesaṃ ajjhāpajjanto diṭṭho hoti, saṅghādisese saṅghādisesadiṭṭhi hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:3.1.1.eng: A monk sees a second monk committing an offense entailing suspension, and the first monk regards it as an offense entailing suspension.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:3.1.2.eng: If he then accuses him of an offense entailing expulsion, saying,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:3.1.3.eng: “You’re not an ascetic, not a Sakyan monastic.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:3.1.4.pli: natthi tayā saddhiṃ uposatho vā pavāraṇā vā saṅghakammaṃ vā”ti,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:3.1.4.eng: You’re excluded from the observance-day ceremony, from the invitation ceremony, and from the legal procedures of the Sangha,”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:3.1.5.pli: evampi āpattaññabhāgiyaṃ hoti leso ca upādinno, āpatti vācāya, vācāya saṅghādisesassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:3.1.5.eng: thus using an unrelated offense as a pretext, he commits an offense entailing suspension for each statement.
